body_html:
Hi, thank you for your reply.

$ pip uninstall torch
Uninstalling torch-0.5.0a0+9ee5133:
  Would remove:
    /home/carmocca/PyLaia/PyLaia-env/lib/python2.7/site-packages/torch
    /home/carmocca/PyLaia/PyLaia-env/lib/python2.7/site-packages/torch-0.5.0a0+9ee5133-py2.7.egg-info
Proceed (y/n)? y
  Successfully uninstalled torch-0.5.0a0+9ee5133

$ pip uninstall torch
Skipping torch as it is not installed.

$ python setup.py install
... Everything OK.

Doing the steps you mentioned I realized that I am not getting the TypeError when installing Torch but a custom extension of mine (My bad!).

However, it uses the class BuildExtension from torch/utils/cpp_extension.py which has the following comment:

When using :class:BuildExtension, it is allowed to supply a dictionary for extra_compile_args (rather than the usual list)

This seems to suggest that the logic between ffi/create_extension and utils/cpp_extension has diverged.

Any idea?

body:
Hi, thank you for your reply.

```
$ pip uninstall torch
Uninstalling torch-0.5.0a0+9ee5133:
  Would remove:
    /home/carmocca/PyLaia/PyLaia-env/lib/python2.7/site-packages/torch
    /home/carmocca/PyLaia/PyLaia-env/lib/python2.7/site-packages/torch-0.5.0a0+9ee5133-py2.7.egg-info
Proceed (y/n)? y
  Successfully uninstalled torch-0.5.0a0+9ee5133

$ pip uninstall torch
Skipping torch as it is not installed.

$ python setup.py install
... Everything OK.
```

Doing the steps you mentioned I realized that I am not getting the TypeError when installing Torch but a custom extension of mine (My bad!).

However, it uses the class `BuildExtension` from torch/utils/cpp_extension.py which has the following [comment](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/torch/utils/cpp_extension.py#L126-L127):

> When using :class:`BuildExtension`, it is allowed to supply a dictionary for ``extra_compile_args`` (rather than the usual list)

This seems to suggest that the logic between ffi/create_extension and utils/cpp_extension has diverged.

Any idea?
